page.title: 08EMLEY MOOR MAST
page.content: A group of people in our class went to the mast and Paul Sykes went up to the top of it. They all brought back some information on the mast. Emley Moor mast is the biggest mast of its kind in the whole of Europe. Its height is an outstanding 330 metres or 1084 feet. There have been three previous masts in the same place as the present one. One of the previous masts fell down in March 1969 because the stabilising cables froze and the ice was so heavy the mast fell down. Although the mast fell through a nearby chapel roof no-one was hurt. The building of the present mast started in June 1969 and was finished in 1970. The mast started transmitting again in 1971 and has been on the air with programmes and radio services for 13 years since it was rebuilt.
